pullRequest.body:
Given two complex shapes `c : ComplexShape Œπ` and `c' : ComplexShape Œπ'` for homological complexes, an embedding from `c` to `c'` (`e : c.Embedding c'`) consists of the data of an injective map `f : Œπ ‚Üí Œπ'` such that for all `i‚ÇÅ i‚ÇÇ : Œπ`, `c.Rel i‚ÇÅ i‚ÇÇ` implies `c'.Rel (e.f i‚ÇÅ) (e.f i‚ÇÇ)`.

This notion was originally introduced in the Liquid Tensor Experiment. It shall be further expanded in order to formalize truncation functors on the derived category.

---

nodes.body: üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9193907104/job/25286074268)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9193907104/job/25286075321)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9193907104/job/25286076061)
The docstring is a bit unclear, since the definition doesn't mention `c'.next`.¬†Same below.

The definition involves `c'.Rel`, and it is quite obvious that it is equivalent (because `c'.next i' = i'` when there is no `j'` such that `c'.Rel i' j'`). I am not so sure that the docstring would be better if it would just be a paraphrase of the definition.
Is there any useful embedding that does not satisfy `IsRelIff`? If not, maybe `RelEmbedding c.Rel c'.Rel` is good enough?
Given a complex shape `c`, there is the complex shape with the same index type but no relations at all, and this one embeds into `c`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/Homology): embeddings of complex shapes
